ca.cgjennings.spelling.policy

Class PolicyChain

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.cgjennings.spelling.policy.AbstractWordPolicy
      • ca.cgjennings.spelling.policy.PolicyChain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PhoneticHashProvider, WordPolicy

    public class PolicyChain
extends AbstractWordPolicy
    A PolicyChain combines two WordPolicy instances into a single policy. The general contract is that this policy "prefers" the first policy and defers to it whenever it returns an atypical result. If the first policy returns a typical or default result, then the second policy is consulted and its result is used as the result of the operation. For more details on the behaviour of this class, refer to the individual method descriptions.

    • Method Detail

      • createPolicyChain

        public static WordPolicy createPolicyChain(WordPolicy... policies)
        Returns a policy that chains together all of the specified policies. If one policy is specified, it is returned. Otherwise, a recursive chain of PolicyChains is returned as if by executing code of the form: 
         new PolicyChain( policies[0], new PolicyChain( policies[1], new PolicyChain( policies[2], ... ) ) );
        Parameters:
        policies - an array of policies to chain together
        Returns:
        a recursive policy chain consisting of the supplied policies
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if policies is empty
        NullPointerException - if policies is null

      • evaluate

        public Object evaluate(String word)
        The first policy will evaluate the word. If it returns an Evaluation result, then this policy returns that result. Otherwise, the result of the first policy is evaluated by the second policy, and that result is returned.
        Specified by:
        evaluate in interface WordPolicy
        Overrides:
        evaluate in class AbstractWordPolicy
        Parameters:
        word -
        Returns:
        the word to be looked up, or null if it should be accepted

      • getFirstPolicy

        Return the first policy in the chain.
        Returns:
        the first policy in the chain

      • getHint

        public Object getHint(WordPolicy.Hint key)
        Return the value of a policy hint. If the first policy returns the default value, the hint from the second policy is returned. Otherwise, the hint from the first policy is returned.
        Specified by:
        getHint in interface WordPolicy
        Overrides:
        getHint in class AbstractWordPolicy
        Parameters:
        key - the key to fetch a hint for
        Returns:
        the value for the requested hint

      • getPhoneticHash

        public String getPhoneticHash(String word)
        Return a hash code representing how a string is pronounced. This can be used to help rank spelling suggestions, so that words that sound more similar are favoured more highly.

        Policies that do not provide a phonetic hashing algorithm must throw UnsupportedOperationException. The AbstractWordPolicy implementation of this method always throws UnsupportedOperationException. If the first policy supports phonetic hashing, this method returns the distance it computes. Otherwise, if the second policy supports phonetic hashing, this method returns the distance it computes. If neither policy supports phonetic distances, this method throws an UnsupportedOperationException.

        Specified by:
        getPhoneticHash in interface PhoneticHashProvider
        Specified by:
        getPhoneticHash in interface WordPolicy
        Overrides:
        getPhoneticHash in class AbstractWordPolicy
        Parameters:
        word - the word to obtain a hash code for
        Returns:
        the phonetic hash of the word
        See Also:
        #hasPhonetics}

      • getSecondPolicy

        public WordPolicy getSecondPolicy()
        Return the second policy in the chain.
        Returns:
        the second policy in the chain

      • getTypistErrorModel

        public TypistErrorModel getTypistErrorModel()
        Returns a model of keys that are frequently mistaken for each other while typing. This can be used to improve the quality of suggestions.

        If the first policy returns the default value for Hint.ADJACENT_KEY_CAPS, returns the second policy's error model. Otherwise, returns the first policy's error model. (However, it will always return a non-null if one is available.)

        Specified by:
        getTypistErrorModel in interface WordPolicy
        Overrides:
        getTypistErrorModel in class AbstractWordPolicy
        Returns:
        the most specific error model available from the policies

      • hasPhonetics

        public boolean hasPhonetics()
        Return true if this policy can perform phonetic hashing. The AbstractWordPolicy implementation of this method returns false. If at least one of the two chained policies returns true for this method, then this method returns true. Otherwise, it returns false.
        Specified by:
        hasPhonetics in interface WordPolicy
        Overrides:
        hasPhonetics in class AbstractWordPolicy
        Returns:
        true if at least one of the chained policies supports phonetic distances

      • modifySuggestion

        public String modifySuggestion(String word,
                               String suggestion)
        The first policy is presented with the suggestion, and the suggestion it returns is then presented to the second policy. This result is then returned.
        Specified by:
        modifySuggestion in interface WordPolicy
        Overrides:
        modifySuggestion in class AbstractWordPolicy
        Parameters:
        word - the word for which suggestions have been requested
        suggestion - a suggested replacement for the word
        Returns:
        the original suggestion or a replacement

      • setFirstPolicy

        public void setFirstPolicy(WordPolicy firstPolicy)
        Set the first policy in the chain.
        Parameters:
        firstPolicy - the policy that will be checked first

      • setSecondPolicy

        public void setSecondPolicy(WordPolicy secondPolicy)
        Set the second policy in the chain. This policy is only checked if the first policy does not return null.
        Parameters:
        secondPolicy - the policy that will be checked second
